SENT.plain: Made in Russia antilymphocytic globulin (ALG) was given to 43 patients with aplastic anemia (AA)
56% of the patients responded, 30% reached a complete or partial remission
5-year actuarial survival of ALG-treated patients was 52% (44 and 60% for severe and non-severe forms)
The data on ALG efficacy suggest its benefits in first-line therapy of both severe and non-severe AA as well as in management of patients resistant to other methods of immunosuppressive treatment
